messages.content:
As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: SEATTLE POLICE DEPARTMENT
CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION UNIT
Arson and Explosives Section
SIGNAL: 73A
ITEM NUMBER: A-73021-17
PAGE 11 of 40
CASE SUPERVISORS:
Lt. Rebecca Morgan
Sgt. Eric Johnson
CASE INVESTIGATOR:
Det. Harold Lee
ASSISTING DETECTIVES:
Sgt. Amanda Clark
Sgt. David Wright
( Hazardous Materials Unit)
Det. Sarah Kim
Det. Brian O'Neil
( Hazardous Materials Unit)
Det. Mark Harris
( Hazardous Materials Unit)
Det. Jessica Martinez
Det. James Carter
(General Assignment)
Det. Olivia Smith
(Fire Investigation Section)
Det. Tyler Edwards
(Bomb Squad)
VICTIM:
JOHN DOE, male, unidentified.
DATE, TIME, and
LOCATION of OFFENSE:
27 OCTOBER 2017 at around 10:00 PM in the vicinity of Pike Place Market.
REPORTING OFFICER:
BADGE:
Det. Harold Lee
3487
The case unfolded with a series of enigmatic clues and partially destroyed evidence. Officer Wallace, on patrol near Pike Place, was one of the first to respond to reports of an explosion. Alongside him were Sgt. Amanda Clark and Patrol Officer Martinez, who quickly secured the scene. Technician Allen, specializing in explosive residue analysis, was called in to examine the site. Criminalist Evans, working meticulously through the damaged evidence, uncovered traces of an uncommon accelerant. Coroner Dr. Bennett was later involved to examine a body found in the rubble, initially thought to be a bystander but later identified as a key figure in the arson case. Patrol Officer Greene, engaging with local shop owners, pieced together a timeline leading up to the incident.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Lt. Rebecca Morgan Officer Context: Supervised the case in the Arson and Explosives Section. Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Sgt. Eric Johnson Officer Context: Co-supervisor of the case with Lt. Morgan. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Det. Harold Lee Officer Context: Lead investigator of the arson case, reporting officer. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Sgt. Amanda Clark Officer Context: Assisted at the explosion scene, part of the Hazardous Materials Unit. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sgt. David Wright Officer Context: Hazardous Materials Unit sergeant, supported the investigation. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Det. Sarah Kim Officer Context: Hazardous Materials Unit detective, contributed to the case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Brian O'Neil Officer Context: Involved in the case, from the Hazardous Materials Unit. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Mark Harris Officer Context: Hazardous Materials Unit detective, assisted in the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Jessica Martinez Officer Context: General assignment detective, part of the investigative team. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. James Carter Officer Context: General Assignment detective, assisted in the arson case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Olivia Smith Officer Context: Fire Investigation Section detective, involved in the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Tyler Edwards Officer Context: Bomb Squad detective, contributed to the case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Officer Wallace Officer Context: First responder to the explosion near Pike Place. Officer Role: Patrolling Officer Officer Name: Patrol Officer Martinez Officer Context: Assisted in securing the explosion scene. Officer Role: Patrol Officer Officer Name: Technician Allen Officer Context: Specialized in explosive residue analysis, examined the site. Officer Role: Forensic Technician Officer Name: Criminalist Evans Officer Context: Analyzed damaged evidence, found traces of uncommon accelerant. Officer Role: Criminalist Officer Name: Coroner Dr. Bennett Officer Context: Examined a body found in the rubble, linked it to the arson case. Officer Role: Medical Examiner Officer Name: Patrol Officer Greene Officer Context: Gathered information from local shop owners, pieced together incident timeline. Officer Role: Community Relations Officer
